reviews.sentence: Pleasant. The location was great for why we were there. Walking distance to mecum auto auction. parking was god staff very nice. breakfast was godfor the price the room was very bad terribly stained carpet bed and pillows were not comfortable. it seemed like a motel 6 type place. we are frequent travelers and I felt I had to apologize repeatedly for the room. it was clean though.

Park and walk. We were able to walk 2 or 3 blocks for restaurants. The rail service to get to the museums theaters and baseball park was clean efficient and cheap 125 one way. The hotel was within 3 blocks of the metro stop. The comfortable seating in the rooms sitting area. The new comfortable bed. Not much to do at this location but within easy access by rail to museums theaters and ballpark. Close to football stadium.

Decent stay at a reasonable price. Good. nice clean room friendly staff convenient location to Med Center West U shopping free secure parking. Typical breakfast but fast wi fi. Beds were very comfortable and living rom bedroom split a great. Walk to primary shopping and restaurants. Marginal two elevators very slow for 7 flors ask for booking on 1st 2nd floors. Older sofa carptet squares sticky but very cleanWe will stay here again.
Exceptional. The service was excellent and very clean and i loved the fact that they have a very secured parking area.

Great Value for the price. Good Breakfast area great mattresses got great sleep. We liked the security person patrolling the parking areas and hallways. Great access for our handicapped Granddaughter.

Good hotel for the money. We were just there for one night. Pretty simple expectations. Clean room controllable room temp good shower water pressure easy parking and comfortable bed. The only thing that came up short was the bed was hard as a rock and I am someone who likes a firm bed so it was really hard. Other than that the place checked every box on the list. I would definitely stay here again.

Would be Better if Cleaner. I am usually very happy with Springhil Suites but most of the locations in which I have stayed are relatively new properties. Even though this property is well into middle age it would be fine if it was cleaner. The location is very good if you are visiting the Medical Center or NRG Park. The staff is friendly and helpful the shuttle service to the Medical Center is great and the happy hour is a nice plus.
Comfortable and friendly staff. Free parking and convenient location.

Needs Renovation. In need of serious mskeover. Looks and feels outdated. Pillows need an upgrade as they gave me a neck ache. Needs more sitting places at breakfast time. However the staff is very friendly snd helpful. Love to have free parking free wifi snd free breakfast.
Fair. Close proximity to NRG Park. Bathroom was not clean at all.
It was under construction and parking lot was too small.

The room met our needs very well. Kitchen staff and desk staff were super nice. Breakfast was very good. Half the parking lot was closed due to new surface. Security directed me to garage next door late at night and alone. When I complained to the desk clerk she told me Security was supposed to escort me over there for safety.

Never Again. Manager does not Respond. I love staying at Mariot Hotels and normally have good or great experiences. However this stay unfortunately ended very unprofesionaly. It began when I checked out of the room on the Friday morning before the start of the Memorial Day weekend. That morning I was involved in a vehicle accident and was very flustered. After checking out I had driven about three hours from the hotel when I realized that I had forgotten something in my room. I checked out at aprox. 1030 am and it was now aprox. 130 pm. I immediately called the hotel and informed them that I left a very important item in my room and I informed them exactly where the item was in the room. It was very visible and difficult to miss in the front room as soon as you opened the door. I was told that housekeeping was still cleaning the room and would locate my item and bring it to lost and found. I would then get a phone call about how and where my item could be mailed to me. Well that phone call NEVER came. I called back the hotel later that evening and was told that I had to call back in the morning. When I called in the morning I spoke with a manager named Michael and informed him how important this item was to me. He assured me that he would look into my lost item with housekeeping and the current guest in the room and get back to me. HE NEVER DID. Over the next few days I spoke with several employees and still no one was able to help me. Now I have worked at a Mariot and know that check in time is 30 pm. If I called at 130 pm when no one was in the room why could not someone just retrieve my item. I also know that if housekeeping finds something they are required to turn it in. So since my item was very easily seen in the front room where is it Springhil. I called the hotel aprox. eight times from Friday to Monday and left several messages for the Manager Michael. I was informed that two different guests had checked in and out of the same hotel room since Friday making it impossible to locate my missing item. I was very upset and frustrated because if my request and problem was addressed properly from my first call I know that my item would have been recovered. This is not the service or run around that I expect from any Mariot. Thanks Springhil Suites. To date Michael has still not called me back. I have now contacted corporate and was given a case number.

Poorly Maintained. There was construction at the main entrance to the hotel which was distracting and disruptive. It did not allow for a pleasant environment during the stay. This also affected the parking requiring longer walks transit through a busy parking lot with small children. During our stay the laundry facilities were broken with only one operational washer and the other failed while doing laundry requiring a call to maintenance staff to resolve an already bad situation. During checkout the morning our departure there was only one operational elevator. These are basic requirements in this type of hotel and I feel they significantly and negatively impacted our stay. If I pay full price for a hotel room I expect full amenities. That was not the case in this stay.

wonderful will stay again. We had to go to Houston for medical appointments it was already a very stressful time. We did not know anything about Houston. We were stressing on getting to and from the hospital not knowing where we were going parking etc. The lady at the counter Michele Chavez greeted us very sweetly and explained to us that the shuttle would take us and we did not have to worry about driving there and back. One worry settled she explained everything that the hotel offered and took care of all of our needs. They were doing construction in the front but it did not affect our stay at all. Under the circumstances we had an excellent stay. The room was a whole lot bigger than we expected very nice. We had a wonderful stay. Will stay there again when we go back to Houston. Thanks.

A lot of construction was going on so the front parking lot and entrance had been closed and moved to the rear of the building. It made parking possible but a little iffy. Two families were checking in at the front desk so that took a little longer than necessary since one girl was handling the check in and the phones.
Exceptional. Happy hour was nice. Did not like the parking gate.

We felt our car was safe in the parking lot although we did n’t think it was appropriate that we had to pay to park as a guest. The room had a little bit of a stale odor and there were some stains on the couch. The bedroom and bathroom were very nice though.

Good. the staff was very nice. they were always happy and very attentive. bokingcom did not share there was a parking fee on the site and the staff waived the fee for usthe air conditioner made a humming noise all night and it was hard to sleep.

Comfortable hotel convenient to the medical center. We stayed here for medical appointments at M D Anderson. It was convenient and the staff were very friendly. There was a free breakfast and the choices were good. Some nights during the week there is a happy hour where light appetizers and drinks are served. I am not a drinker so I do not know if the drinks are an additional charge or not. The night we went they had wings chips and salsa and cookies. Everyone seemed to enjoy gathering with friends or coworkers at that time of day. There is gated parking for 6 day as well as a free shuttle to the medical center area. The shuttle drivers were great. There is a Walgrens very close by and many restaurants as well possibly walking distance but we had a car.
